thread.title: TV | Live Rugby World Cup 2015
thread.title_full: TV | Live Rugby World Cup 2015 - entertainment.ie

author: Charlotte McCarthy
title: TV | Live Rugby World Cup 2015
text:
Today's games:
2.00pm - Pool B: Samoa vs Japan
Kick-off: 2.30pm
Stadium MK
Everybody's second favourite team, Japan, attempt to keep themselves in contention for a quarter-final place with a victory over Samoa, who themselves will be looking for a win to bounce back from a 40 point defeat to South Africa. Both teams are evenly matched, which should make for a great game.
4.00pm - Pool B: South Africa vs Scotland
Kick-off: 4.45pm
St. James Park
The first of the day's big, big games. What should have been a pool decider is now a must win game for South Africa if they want to avoid a shock early exit. The Scottish have never beaten South Africa outside of Scotland, but with the game taking place just over the border in Newcastle they are guaranteed to have strong support providing 16th man advantage.
7.00pm - Pool A: England vs Australia
Kick-Off 8.00pm
Twickenham
This show down between England and Australia was always going to big game, but for England it is now their biggest game of the tournament. If they lose, they are most probably out of their own World Cup, which would be mighty embarrassing. The Twickenham crowd will be in full voice, but that's not going intimidate the Australian team who will be focused on staying on track to win the pool. It's a game not to be missed.
